meanings.sent1: I had to reinstall the app on my phone after it stopped working.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to reinstall the software on your computer for it to work properly.
meanings.sent3: I had to reinstall the game on my computer because my cat accidentally uninstalled it.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, we had to reinstall the roof tiles to protect the house.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to reinstall the engine in the car to get it running again.

meanings.definition: To put (something) back in place or position.
meanings.sent1: Please reinstall the book on the shelf where it belongs.
meanings.sent2: The worker had to reinstall the fallen signpost by the road.
meanings.sent3: I had to reinstall the misplaced puzzle piece to complete the picture.
meanings.sent4: The artist decided to reinstall the painting on a different wall for better visibility.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the student to reinstall the marker in the pen holder after use.
